conclusion: The side length of the wire frame is 0.2m, and its total resistance is 4Ω.
Half of the wire frame is in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the paper and directed inward.
The relationship between the magnitude of the magnetic induction intensity B and time t is B=(3 + 2t)T.
The wire frame remains stationary from t = 0 to t = 5s.
Find the magnitude and direction of the frictional force acting on the wire frame at the moment t = 2.5s.
The resistance R is given by R = V/I where V is the voltage and I is the current.
Since the wire frame is stationary, the voltage V is equal to the resistance R, thus R = 4Ω.
Calculate B at t = 2.5s using B = (3 + 2t)T, resulting in B = 8T.
The frictional force F is given by F = μN where μ is the friction coefficient and N is the normal force.
The normal force N is equal to the weight of the wire frame, W = mg.
The mass m is calculated as m = 1/2 * 0.2m * 2 = 0.2m.
The acceleration due to gravity g is 9.8m/s².
The normal force N is calculated as N = mg = 1.96N.
The friction coefficient μ is calculated as μ = F/N = 1.
Calculate the frictional force F = μN = 1 * 1.96N = 1.96N.
The magnitude of the frictional force acting on the wire frame at t = 2.5s is 1.96N.
